servinfo.title: DTC B1324 / B1328: Left / Right Side-Air Bag Initiator Circuit Short to Power Circuit

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC B1321 / B1325: Left / Right Side-Air Bag Initiator Circuit Resistance High .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

servinfosub.title: DTC Will Set when
servinfosub.ptxt: The voltage measured at side-air bag (left or right) initiator circuit is above a specified value for specified time.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check whether malfunction is in side-air bag (inflator) module.
Step 2: Check side-air bag initiator circuit in floor harness.
Step 3: Check side-air bag initiator circuit in seat harness.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect side-air bag (inflator) module connector under front seat cushion.
Check proper connection to left or right side-air bag (inflator) module at terminals in “L25” or “L30” connector.
If OK, then connect special tools (B) and (C) to side-air bag (inflator) module connector disconnected at the Step 1.

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1324 or B1328 still indicated?

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect special tools (B), (C) and SDM connector “L33”.
Release shorting bar in SDM connector inserting release tool (1) included in special tool (A).

Measure voltage between “L33-1” and body ground, and between “L33-2” and ground (for DTC B1324) or “L33-3” and body ground, and between “L33-4” and body ground (for DTC B1328) with connected special tools (B) and (C).

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is voltage 1 V or less?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.

paragroup.ptxt: DTC B1324: Repair short from “GRY/RED” or “GRY” wire circuit to power circuit in floor harness.
DTC B1328: Repair short from “BRN/WHT” or “BRN” wire circuit to power circuit in floor harness.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect special tools (B) and (C) then reconnect connector “L25” or “L30”.
Disconnect side-air bag (inflator) module connector “Q02” or “Q03” from side-air bag (inflator) module.
Check proper connection to side-air bag (inflator) module at terminal in connector.
If OK, then connect special tools (A), (B) and (C) to side-air bag (inflator) connector.

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1064 or B1068 still indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: DTC B1324: Repair short from “GRY/RED” or “GRY” wire circuit to power circuit in seat harness.
DTC B1328: Repair short from “BRN/WHT” or “BRN” wire circuit to power circuit in seat harness.

action.ptxt: Replace side-air bag (inflator) module referring to Side-Air Bag (Inflator) Module Removal and Installation .

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components, ensure all components are properly mounted.
Clear DTCs referring to DTC Clearance , if any.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
